item.ENTRY: Please enter the name of the CLASS.
This catalogue will be sorted by Keyword
MM: ZMMMR024 - GENERAL SUPPLIES: BY KEYWORD, PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION

TLINE.TDLINE: ,,CENTRA-UNION GAS LIMITED -- CATALOGUES FOR MATERIAL MANAGEMENT
&DESCRIPTION&
,,The report will consist of a report heading followed underneath it by
the names of the columns that will be reported on. The top left corner
will display the date and time the report was executed. The top right
corner will display the program name and underneath it will be
displayed the page number. The maximum number of lines that can be
printed on a single page is 65.
,,At the Selection Screen the name of the class will be automatically
be entered for each different catalogue. Below the name of the Class
will be a comment on the sort structure for that catalogue.
,,Each catalogues will have a title based on the Superior Class being
reported on. Directly underneath the title will be listed the fields
that the catalogues are sorted on.
,,In the case where a catalogue is reporting on a Superior Class that
has more than one Class beneath it, a solid line will be printed across
the page with the name of the Class on top, followed by the information
for that Class.
,,In catalogues where a Superior Class has two levels of subclasses, a
new page will be started when the Class (first level subclass) changes.
When the SubClass (second level subclass) changes a solid line with
the name of the subclass will be displayed
,,If a index is need for a catalogue, the index will be created after
the catalogue is printed. The index will have a title based on the
class entered at the selection screen. Directly underneath the title
will be listed the fields that the catalogue is sorted on.
,,In the case where a catalogue is reporting on a Superior Class that
has more than one subclass beneath it, the index will be sort and
displayed by Class first. The second sort will occur within each
subclass using the keywords. The same occurs in the case where a
Superior Class has two levels of subclasses. For example: under the
Appliance catalogue there is the Superior Class Appliances, underneath
Appliances there are the Classes: Accessories, Boilers, Fireplace
Surround, Furnaces, etc. underneath these Classes are the Subclasses.
Superior Class:,,Appliance
,,Class: ,,Accessories:
,,,,SubClass:,,Accessories-Air Conditioners
,,,,SubClass:,,Accessories-Furnaces
,,Class:,,Boilers
,,Class:,,Fireplaces
,,For all catalogues that are reporting on Manufacturer Part Number or
Model Number, if no Manufacturer Part Number (or Model Number) has been
maintain as a characteristic for an item, these materials will be
listed first and sorted by material number.
,,Compressor and Technician Parts will be combined into one catalogue
and will be printed as one.
,,Construction Material Catalogues: The first two catalogues for
Construction Material (ZMMMR006-007) will be combined into one
catalogue and will be printed as one. For these two catalogues,
characteristics material is not set up in SAP for class Well_Drillings.
Characteristics model_number is not set up in SAP for the classes
Pipes and Station_Material.
,,The third catalogue for Construction Material will be printed and
sort by Superior Class, Class, then by Subclass. The information to
be printed on the catalogue is identical regardless of class but the
sort may be different for each sub class. Much of the sort criteria
will not be displayed on the catalogue. Listed below is the multiple
sorts for the Construction Material catalogue:
